CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits and dismissed (non-exhaustion of domesic remedies);Violation of Art. 2 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 2 (procedural aspect);Violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);No violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 5-1;Violation of Art. 13+2;Pecuniary damage and non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE . The second and third applicants were born in DATE and DATE , respectively . They live in the village of PERSON , LOC , in GPE .
CARDINAL . The first applicant is the mother of Mr PERSON , born in DATE . PERSON is the father of the second and third applicants .

CARDINAL . On TIME the first applicant , PERSON and Mr Z. , a police officer , were driving home in a ORG SUV vehicle . At some point they passed by the village of GPE , where the special task force units of GPE and the NORP federal troops had been carrying out a special “ sweeping ” operation .

CARDINAL . At the military checkpoint near GPE NORP federal servicemen stopped the UAZ SUV car . Some of the servicemen were wearing masks and camouflage uniforms ; they all spoke NORP . The servicemen ordered the first applicant , PERSON and Mr Z. to get out of the car , searched them and tied PERSON and Mr Z. 's arms behind their backs .

CARDINAL . The servicemen put the first applicant , PERSON and Mr PERSON in a UAZ minivan . The first applicant noticed that its registration number contained the digits “ CARDINAL ” . The minivan drove off in the direction of ORG . It was followed by a PERSON vehicle . While the minivan was moving , CARDINAL of the servicemen made a phone call . The first applicant overheard the words “ woman , woman ” . Shortly afterwards the servicemen pushed her out of the minivan .

CARDINAL . The first applicant lost consciousness as a result of DATE . Some passers - by discovered her lying by the side of the road and took her home . TIME later the first applicant recovered her senses .
CARDINAL . At some point Mr PERSON was thrown out of the ORG minivan .
CARDINAL . The first applicant has not seen her son since .
CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE in the vicinity of the village of NORP unidentified armed persons wearing camouflage uniforms abducted PERSON and took him away to an unknown destination .

CARDINAL . At some point Mr NORP , PERSON uncle , suggested that the first applicant contact PERSON , the head of the special task force unit who had been in charge of the special “ sweeping ” operation of DATE in GPE NORP . PERSON promised to release PERSON , but then left for a business trip ; at some point he died . Later PERSON deputy denied that PERSON had been arrested .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of LOC ( “ the district prosecutor 's office ” ) instituted an investigation in case no . DATE into the kidnapping of PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant complained about her son 's abduction to the prosecutor 's office of GPE and the military prosecutor 's office of ORG ( “ the ORG prosecutor 's office ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE forwarded the first applicant 's complaint to the district prosecutor 's office .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prosecutor 's office forwarded the first applicant 's complaint to the prosecutor 's office of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office suspended the investigation in case no . CARDINAL for failure to identify those responsible .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office issued a report stating the following . At TIME on DATE in the area of GPE NORP unidentified masked persons in camouflage uniforms armed with machine guns had arrested PERSON and taken him away to an unknown destination . The whereabouts of the missing person had not been established . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office had opened an investigation into the kidnapping in case no . DATE . PERSON PERSON 's wife had been granted victim status .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE forwarded a letter from the first applicant to the district prosecutor 's office and requested an update on progress in the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office informed the first applicant that an investigation into PERSON kidnapping had been opened under the number DATE and that measures were being taken to establish her son 's whereabouts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant wrote to the district prosecutor 's office describing the circumstances of her son 's abduction and asking for the incident to be investigated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , on the first applicant 's request , declared PERSON missing .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was informed that her son had not been held in any of the penitentiary facilities of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE informed the first applicant that the investigation was pending with the district prosecutor 's office .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE forwarded the first applicant 's complaints to the district prosecutor 's office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office informed the first applicant that the investigation in case no . DATE into her son 's kidnapping had been commenced on DATE and had then been suspended on an unspecified date . However , measures were being taken to find PERSON and his kidnappers .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant requested the district prosecutor 's office to grant her victim status , to provide her with copies of the decisions on the institution and suspension of the investigation , to allow her access to the case file and to keep her updated on any progress in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON requested an update on case no . DATE from the district prosecutor 's office .
CARDINAL . It is not clear whether the investigation in case no . DATE has been completed to date .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office received a complaint from the first applicant about the disappearance of her son .

CARDINAL . DATE requests were sent to the heads of law - enforcement units to establish whether any special operations had been carried out in NORP on DATE and whether PERSON had been arrested or involved in the activities of illegal armed groups .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office instituted criminal proceedings in case no . CARDINAL under LAW of LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was granted victim status and questioned .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE received a statement from the first applicant concerning her conversation with PERSON
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office ordered the police to establish Mr Z. 's whereabouts and to identify the owners of the ORG minivan and PERSON vehicle .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE received instructions to carry out an internal inquiry into the kidnapping of PERSON and the head of the NORP district department of ORG ( “ ORG ” ) was ordered to establish the identities of the kidnappers and witnesses to the crime . The replies , received on unspecified dates , indicated that there was no information concerning the first applicant 's son 's whereabouts and that no witnesses had been found .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation in case no . DATE was suspended for failure to identify those responsible .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the district prosecutor 's office quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and resumed the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE was ordered to establish the identity of PERSON and to carry out an internal inquiry into PERSON arrest .
CARDINAL . NORP The district prosecutor 's office asked whether a UAZ minivan with registration number “ CARDINAL ” had been owned by ORG . The reply received was negative .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office requested the heads of the task force unit of ORG and of the NORP district department of the ORG to establish whether PERSON had been arrested or involved in the activities of illegal armed groups . The replies received indicated that the first applicant 's son had not been arrested and there was no information on his involvement in illegal armed groups .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was again questioned as a victim .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the district prosecutor 's office requested several law - enforcement agencies to submit information on the whereabouts of PERSON and Mr PERSON and to establish whether servicemen of the task force unit of ORG had been involved in the applicants ' relative 's kidnapping . It followed from the replies received that no such involvement had been established .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation in case no . DATE was suspended for failure to identify those responsible .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office quashed the decision of DATE and resumed the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , the wife of PERSON and the mother of the second and third applicants , was granted victim status and questioned .

DATE . On DATE Mr V.G. , the head of the local authority of PERSON , was questioned as a witness . He submitted that in DATE , before New Year 's Eve , a special operation had been carried out by the task force unit of GPE in his village for some ten or DATE . Several villagers had been arrested but none of them had disappeared . Mr V.G. vaguely recollected that CARDINAL men had been kidnapped near GPE NORP on DATE but in his opinion servicemen of the task force unit had not been involved in the kidnapping .

CARDINAL . Two police officers were questioned as witnesses in DATE . They stated that a special operation had been carried out in GPE in DATE by the task force unit and that they had heard about PERSON kidnapping but had not known anything about it .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the first applicant and PERSON were questioned again . They did not provide any new information .

CARDINAL . DATE the district prosecutor 's office sent requests to a number of law - enforcement agencies to provide information on whether PERSON had been arrested , whether any special operations had been carried out in GPE NORP at the material time and whether any unidentified dead bodies resembling PERSON had been discovered , and to establish the whereabouts of PERSON and a certain Mr NORP It followed from the replies received that no criminal proceedings had been instituted against PERSON , that he had not been arrested by the task force unit or detained in a penitentiary institution ; Mr PERSON had been killed in DATE ; Mr NORP lived in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr M. , a police officer responsible for the applicants ' home village of PERSON , was questioned as a witness and stated that PERSON had been a member of an illegal armed group .
CARDINAL . Five more people were questioned as witnesses in DATE . They did not report any new information .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office ordered the police to check if PERSON had had any connections with illegal armed groups .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office ordered the NORP district department of the ORG to check if PERSON had had any contact with any of the leaders of illegal armed groups . It followed from the reply received that since DATE PERSON had been a member of an illegal armed group .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was again suspended .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant requested the district prosecutor 's office to grant her victim status .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was informed that she had been granted victim status on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Groznenksiy inter - district investigating unit of the investigating department of ORG of ORG for GPE ( “ the investigating unit ” ) quashed the decision of DATE and notified the first applicant accordingly .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating unit ordered the police to establish Mr D. 's place of residence and the circumstances surrounding the death of PERSON , as well as to take steps to establish the whereabouts of PERSON and find witnesses to his kidnapping .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating unit requested the traffic police to establish whether registration numbers “ CARDINAL ” or “ CARDINAL ” had belonged to law - enforcement agencies . According to the replies received , CARDINAL vehicle with registration number “ CARDINAL ” and CARDINAL vehicles with registration numbers “ CARDINAL ” belonged to various branches of ORG . The types of those vehicles were not specified .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating unit asked ORG of GPE if on DATE they had had a ORG minivan with registration numbers “ CARDINAL ” or “ CARDINAL ” . The reply was negative .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating unit requested information concerning the death of Mr Z. It turned out that his dead body had been found on DATE and that an investigation into the murder was pending .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating unit suspended the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office pointed out that the investigation in case no . CARDINAL had been flawed because the following investigative steps had not been taken : Mr NORP , who had allegedly negotiated PERSON release with the task force unit , had not been questioned , PERSON car had not been found and documents concerning his death had not been included in the case file .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation in case no . CARDINAL was resumed .

DATE . On DATE Mr NORP was questioned as a witness . He stated that on DATE he had been told that his nephew , PERSON , had been kidnapped . On DATE he had found out that Mr Z. had been released . The first applicant had asked Mr NORP to help find her son . Mr NORP had talked to the head of the task force unit who had said that his subordinates had not arrested PERSON .

CARDINAL . Despite specific requests by ORG did not disclose most of the materials from the investigation file in case no . DATE . They submitted copies of the decisions to open , suspend and re - open the investigation , records of witnesses ' interviews and several replies by the authorities to the applicant and explained that they had provided the “ main case - file materials ” .
CARDINAL . For a summary of the relevant domestic law see PERSON and PERSON GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) .
